Header:
Mouse tumor models have greatly enhanced our understanding of tumorigenesis and are widely
utilized as the preferred model organism for cancer studies and preclinical drug testing. The ability
to evaluate the multiparametric response in the tumor microenvironment (TME) is crucial to predict
therapeutic drug efficacy. Particularly, assessment of immunological and oncological processes that dictate
tumor growth, metastasis, and immune response are essential for identifying candidates for further
clinical evaluation. Imaging Mass Cytometry™ (IMC™) permits analysis of 40-plus distinct tissue and cellular markers simultaneously on tumor samples, providing a thorough evaluation of the spatial landscape of the
TME.
See how we and present quantitative evaluation of the cellular and structural landscape of mouse non-small cell
lung cancer (NSCLC) TME.

Waypoints.Name: Cell Segmentation Panel
Waypoints.Description: Segment with confidence using the IMC Cell Segmentation Kit*. Benefit from a robust end-to-end workflow for single-cell data analytics for your high-plex Imaging Mass Cytometry™ (IMC™) data. The IMC Cell Segmentation Kit includes three individual plasma membrane markers for improved nucleus and plasma membrane demarcation. Notice how by using this kit 100% of all cells are stained with our cell segmentation markers.

Waypoints.Name: Mouse Immune Activation Panel
Waypoints.Description:
Maxpar OnDemand Mouse Immune Activation IMC Panel Kit (Cat. No. 9100004) assesses the functional
state of immune cells in tumors.

Waypoints.Name: Mouse Tissue Architecture Panel
Waypoints.Description:
Maxpar OnDemand Mouse Tissue Architecture IMC Panel Kit (Cat. No. 9100001) identifies the underlying
cellular and structural markers of the tumor.

Waypoints.Name: Mouse Immune Phenotyping Panel
Waypoints.Description:
Maxpar OnDemand Mouse Immune Phenotyping IMC Panel Kit (Cat. No. 9100003) delineates lymphoid
and myeloid cell subtypes of immune cell infiltrates in tumors.

Waypoints.Name: Replicating and regulatory T Cells
Waypoints.Description:
Ki-67 highlights replicating immune cells in NSCLC. FoxP3 expression in CD4 T cells identifies exhausted T regulatory cells 
Regulatory T cells are identified by arrows
